Reason: The native_transport_max_threads configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the maximum number of client connections that can be handled concurrently by the server. Changing this value can significantly affect system performance by either improving or degrading the throughput and response time of client requests. A higher value can lead to better parallelism and increased throughput, while a lower value can result in bottlenecks and decreased performance due to limited concurrency.
